tourOverview: We will arrive to Santiago, the capital of Chile, a lovely city located at the foothills of the Andes and where, nearby, we will find spectacular viñedos (vineyards) such as the Concha y Toro. Then we flight to Calama, to see the famous Atacama, one of the driest deserts in the world. Our next stop will be on Puerto Mont in the beautiful area known as the Lake Region. Our last visit will be to the region of the Chilean Patagonia a fantastic area with an extraordinary national park known as las Torres del Paine and the Balmaceda & Serrano Glaciers.

dayByDay.dayDescription: Upon your arrival in Santiago, you will be welcomed and transferred to your hotel of choice. We will enjoy of an afternoon, half day city tour of the highlights of the city

dayByDay.dayTitle: Flight from Santiago – Calama – San Pedro de Atacama
dayByDay.dayDescription: The Atacama desert if known as one of the driest places on planet earth, attracting the interest of the scientific community for years. In the morning we will take a flight to Calama, the main hub for entry to the Atacama desert. Here we will take our transportation to head out to San Pedro de Atacama, explore the incredible nadscapes fo the moon valley and overnight at a local hotel

This day we will explore the 'altiplano' region of the Atacama desert, explore the high altitude andean lagoons, and observe the incredible diversity of creatures inhabiting this unique habitat. We will stop by a local restaurant for food in the afternoon while exploring this incredible landscape

The whole region of Atacama is full of volcanic activity involving volcanoes, geysers, fumaroles, mud volcanos and hot psrings. This day we will explore the area know an El Tatio, learn about the unique volcanic activity happening int his remote area, and even enjoy of a dip in the delicious hot spring waters of the region

dayByDay.dayTitle: San Pedro de Atacama – Calama – Santiago – Puerto Montt
dayByDay.dayDescription: after breakfast we will head back to Calama to catch our flight back to Santiago, and to connect to Puerto Montt. Upon your arrival, our team will pick you up and transfer you to Puerto Varas.

The area of Puerto Montt is known as the province of the lakes, and is surrounded by gorgeous scenery, cristaline andean lakes and volcanoes. Today we will visit lake Llanquihue, and Frutillar, two highlights of the area, and enjoy exploring this remote location close to the sea.

The Osorno Volcano is known for marking the northern end of the Patagonia Region in Chile. Towering quietly over lake Llanquihue, this scenic sight will be part of our visit today. We will explore the Mountain Center, and the V. Perez National park before returning back to our hotel.
Flight to Punta Arenas and transfer to Puerto Natales
Ship tour (11 to 12 hours) to Balmaceda & Serrano Glaciers full day group tour
Full day (10 to 12 hours) tour to the spectacular Torres del Paine National Park
Overland transfer to Punta Arenas, and flight to Santkago. Transfer services included
After breakfast transfer to the airport for your flight back home

tourOverview: in this enjoyable itinerary in Argentina you will explore the most important tourist attractions of this amazing country. We start visiting Buenos Aires, the capital of Argentina. Then we flight to the End of the World, to the city of Ushuaia where we will visit the Tierra del Fuego National Park, where we also will enjoy a spectacular boat tour to observe penguins and other interesting marine life. Our next visit will be to Calafate and to the amazing Glacier Perito Moreno National Park. Our tour will end with a visit to the fabulous Iguazu Waterfalls. A fantastic trip which combines the best of Argentina

dayByDay.dayDescription: Upon your arrival in Buenos Aires, you will be welcomed and transferred to your hotel of choice. We will enjoy of an afternoon, half day city tour of the highlights of the city
6-hour day tour to visit this magnificent European style city

dayByDay.dayTitle: Flight from Buenos Aires to Ushuaia
dayByDay.dayDescription: Our guide and transport will take you to the airport in time for your lfight to Patagonia. In the afternoon our team will pick you up and take you to your hotel. Free afternoon in Ushuaia

The Tierra del Fuego National Park was home to a fascinating culture known as the Fuegians, and is one of the southernmost regions of the American Continent. Today we will explore this national park, and enjoy the unique Patagonian Lanscapes.

Today we will do a half day trip to the Beagle channel, a historically important commerce route with amazing landscapes and impressive fjords. Close to the channel we find a large Pinguin Colony which we will visit in the afternoon wth a shared tour service
We will take a flight (1.5 h) to Calafate. Upon arrival our team will take you to your Hotel accommodations and we will have the afternoon free at your leisure

From Calafate, we can have aeasy access to some of Argentina's Patagonia most interesting sites. We will explore the Perito Moreno National Park, including the impressive glacier and surrounding areas full of natural beauty
Flight back to Buenos aires, and free afternoon

dayByDay.dayTitle: Flight (2 h) from Buenos Aires to Iguazu
dayByDay.dayDescription: An early morning transfer will take us to the airport to catch our flight to Iguazu, one of the most impressive waterfall systems in the world. This impressive natural formation  is located within the borders of three south american countries, and is of vital importance to the electricity grid of Argentina, Brazil and Paraguay. Upon arrival, our team will take you to your hotel
We will begin out Iguazu Great Adventure Tour & Visit the Argentinian side of the Iguazu Waterfalls. Using the walkways and small local boats we will get close to the waterfall

Our team will take you to the airport and return back to Buenos Aires. In the evening we will witness one of South america's most delicate traditions: Tango, with an incredible dinner and show combination.
After breakfast transfer to the airport for your flight back home
